tv.generator-info-name: Processed by Open-EPG Visual Processor v1.0

programme.title: Long Lost Family
programme.desc: Two stories that take us across the globe: a womans search for her birth mother in Sri Lanka and a quest on behalf of a father, longing to find his lost son.

programme.title: Gardening Australia
programme.desc: Sophie Thomson meets a city gardener leading the good life, Jane Edmanson visits a floral haven in the hills, Jerry Coleby-Williams is on St Helena island and Costa Georgiadis explores a garden created for kids to go wild.

programme.title: ABC News Mornings
programme.desc: Stay in the know with whats happening this morning. ABC News brings you up-to-the-minute news to fuel your daily conversations so you can stay connected and follow the discussion across today. Presented by Kathryn Robinson.

programme.title: The Forsytes
programme.desc: Jolyon hopes to fulfil newfound obligations while Jamess attempts to sabotage him intensify. June gets closer to Philip and Soames and Irene marry.

programme.title: Grand Designs Australia
programme.desc: Richard and Erin Sims start out building a farm-style lodge, however it balloons into a building of epic proportions, complete with three wings, seven-metre-high chimneys, and thousands of hand-picked dolerite stones.

programme.title: Maigret
programme.desc: Maigret is hunting the killer of an innocent student when Countess Sophie begs him for help.

programme.title: Spicks And Specks
programme.desc: Ballroom meets Kelly Street with Robert Baxter, Angie Hart, Zoe Coombs Marr and Noah Szto to compete for musical trivia glory, while diagnosing musos and spanking Frank Sinatra. Paul Dempsey turns back time with his cover.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: The team come to the aid of a police officer accused of murder in a coastal community.

programme.title: Rage Charts
programme.desc: Count down the hottest chart hits, and catch up on some of the most promising new popular music videos on rage.

programme.title: Rage
programme.desc: Keep the party vibe going every Saturday morning with wall-to-wall music videos, from classic hits and long-forgotten tracks from the rage vault, to the latest new releases and special features.

programme.title: ABC News At Noon
programme.desc: Lorna Dunkley presents the latest from ABC News on the weekend bringing you todays top stories and coverage of events as they unfold. Plus original reporting, analysis and updated news, sport, weather and information.

programme.title: Maigret
programme.desc: Maigret is hunting the killer of an innocent student when Countess Sophie begs him for help.

programme.title: When The War Is Over
programme.desc: Rachel Griffiths sits down with some Aussie rock legends, and heads to the jungles of Vietnam in a bid to understand the music that united a divided nation.

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: When the body of a missing trawler man is pulled from the sea, DCI Vera Stanhope must delve into the lives of his family in a close knit fishing community.

programme.title: Good Game Spawn Point
programme.sub-title: Cosy Game Round-up and Vision Division
programme.desc: This week on GGSP, Gem looks at three cosy indie games with Roots of Patcha, The Witch Of Fern Island, and Mail Time! Plus, Dr. Deviser puts Emma and Sam through his devious Vision Division challenge!

programme.title: The Powerpuff Girls
programme.desc: Bubbles tries to prove that shes responsible enough to own a dog.

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: The Doctors do the worlds biggest poo in the lab to show you how your digestive system works, and we meet a horse-riding Brilliant Body!

programme.title: Star Wars: Young Jedi Adventures
programme.desc: Hap teams up with the Jedi to rescue his friends

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: Bitzer rounds up the Flock for bedtime. Alas, a noisy intruder scuppers their plans. The Flock must find an inventive way to get rid of the pest if they are ever going to get a good nights rest.

programme.title: Star Wars: Young Jedi Adventures
programme.desc: The Jedi help two bounty hunters work together.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: This penultimate episode sees reigning champions, Apollo, mount their defence of the title against Ms Nightshade, Coyote, Rusty, CrackersNSmash, Meggamouse, Trolley Rage and second place finalist from last series, Carbide.

programme.title: Officially Amazing
programme.desc: From stick flips to bowling strikes, this is the show which is fully of record-breaking surprises.

programme.title: Dragon Ball Super
programme.sub-title: Combat Matches Are A Go! The Captain Is Someone Stronger Than Goku
programme.desc: Bulma suggests summoning Shenron to find the remaining Super Dragon Balls, but even his power is not enough. Beerus reveals theres a fighter stronger than Goku whos going to join the team of the 7th Universe!

programme.title: The Powerpuff Girls
programme.desc: The Girls conspire to break up the Professors new love.

programme.title: Rage
programme.desc: Keep the party vibe going with wall-to-wall music videos, from new releases to classics and the long-forgotten.

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: Roll up roll up, Mr Grumbles funfair has come to town! The doctors reveal how your eye muscles work with an unusual fairground game.

programme.title: Star Wars: Young Jedi Adventures
programme.desc: Nubs searches for a rare, stolen plant.

programme.title: Hard Quiz Kids
programme.sub-title: Dungeon and Dragons, the Inca Empire, Lilo and Stitch and Modern Family
programme.desc: Tom Gleeson is back with four new young experts vying to be the Hard Quiz Champion. Tonights topics are Dungeons and Dragons, the Inca Empire, Lilo and Stitch and Modern Family!

programme.title: Dragon Ball Super
programme.sub-title: A Run-through For The Competition! Who Are The Last Two Members?!
programme.desc: Goku and Vegeta must find two more members for the tournament - but who will be worthy to face the 6th Universe alongside Goku and Vegeta? Gohan? Piccolo? Or even... Majin Buu?!

programme.title: BTN High
programme.desc: BTN High breaks down the weeks biggest news stories for Aussie high schoolers.

programme.title: Rage Charts
programme.desc: Count down the hottest chart hits and catch up on some of the most promising new popular music videos on rage.

programme.title: Absolutely Fabulous: The Collection
programme.desc: The uproarious Patsy is the first of Saunders characters to take centre stage: smoking, drinking - and toppling over - in a succession of media events and mishaps. Patsys the brains behind Edinas worst escapades.

programme.title: Malory Towers
programme.desc: In the Secret Room, Felicity and June discover half of a map hidden in a secret compartment under the floorboards. It must be a clue as to the whereabouts of the hidden treasure!

programme.title: Dragon Ball Super
programme.sub-title: With New Hope In His Heart - Farewell, Trunks
programme.desc: Merged Zamasus ashes rises a universe encompassing darkness. Out of energy and out of options, Goku needs some help, and fast!

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: Bitzer decides to pamper himself with a relaxing bath while the Farmer is away from the farm. However, his plans are rudely disturbed by a persistent intruder. Will Shaun be able to out-smart the tenacious bug?

programme.title: Total Drama Island
programme.desc: Our two teams go to war, firing cabbages from cannons at each other from their respective pirate ships. The first team to sink the other will be the winner, but someone takes a very personal interest in one specific target.

programme.title: We Baby Bears
programme.desc: On their quest for hidden treasure, the Bears team up with Polly the Parrot Pirate.

programme.title: Alphablocks
programme.sub-title: The Cat Sat On The Mat
programme.desc: The Alphablocks sing, the bat and the rat dance - but will the cat ever get up off the mat? This episode has fun with AT and the words mat, cat, rat, bat, hat and vat.

programme.title: Bitesize Daily
programme.desc: Learn about landscape drawing, circle skies and mark making.

programme.title: BTN Newsbreak
programme.desc: Find out whats going on in the world with a news bulletin designed for children, featuring stories that are relevant and easy to understand.

programme.title: Phil Spencer: Secret Agent
programme.desc: Phil travels to Huddersfield. David Wadsworth bought his stone weavers cottage back in the 80s. Since meeting his partner Linda, theyve decided to sell up and buy a house together, but this is easier said than done. (Final)

programme.title: Mythbusters
programme.desc: Adam and Jamie take on one of the greatest inventors and creator of myths of all time. And, the MythBusters delve into a story of a guy who placed a lava lamp on a stove, which led to an explosion and glass shrapnel.

programme.title: Phil Spencer: Secret Agent Specials
programme.desc: A house thats almost beyond help in Worthing and a characterless cottage in Shoreham-by-Sea is what Phil Spencer faces in this double mission.

programme.title: Geostorm
programme.desc: A satellite technician must work together with his estranged brother to save the world from a global storm created by a series of malfunctioning climate-control satellites that have been weaponised.

programme.title: rage Vault Guest Programmer: Tool
programme.desc: Open your third-eye as rage replays Tools 2006 rage hosting, playing Ministry, ATX, A Perfect Circle, Swans and more.

programme.title: ABC News Update
programme.desc: The headlines from ABC News, updating you on the days top stories from across Australia and around the world.

programme.title: Malory Towers
programme.desc: Clarissa invites Ruth to come riding with her but, as usual, Connie jumps in and speaks on behalf of her sister and invites herself along, too. June cant help but have a go at Connie, chiding her for dominating her sister!

programme.title: Dragon Ball Super
programme.sub-title: Come Forth, Shenron! Whose Wish Will Be Granted?
programme.desc: Bulma tries to secretly build a time machine despite Beerus disapproval. Meanwhile, Goku gathers the Dragon Balls to revive King Kai.

programme.title: Hotel Transylvania: The Series
programme.desc: Mavis convinces Pedro and Wendy to each get to know their new step-parents, but things quickly go wrong when Wendy doesnt eat Shondas patented gross beef.

programme.title: Lagging
programme.desc: Leahs worried about a hospital appointment so her friends have organised a surprise day to distract her. Tiana has designed a Team SMorCleWA-themed Escape Room in the basement of the Respawn Point for them all to play.

programme.title: Phil Spencer: Secret Agent Specials
programme.desc: Phil Spencer is in Reigate, Surrey helping to sell a property that looks more like a Swedish sauna than a house. And in Haslemere hes aiding a vendor that really should know better.

programme.title: Live At The Apollo
programme.desc: In this special festive edition of the award-winning Live at the Apollo, the fabulous Jason Manford is your host as he introduces Maisie Adam and Nabil Abdulrashid to the stage.

programme.title: Star Wars: Young Jedi Adventures
programme.desc: Kai and Lys seek out a cure for Nubs illness.

programme.title: Ben And Hollys Little Kingdom
programme.desc: Barnaby Elfs uncle, Redbeard the Elf Pirate, comes to visit the Little Kingdom, but he has lost his treasure. Holly, Ben, the Fairies and the Elves must help Redbeard follow the clues to track down the treasure.

programme.title: Twirlywoos
programme.desc: A man is putting a poster up on a billboard. The Twirlywoos are watching him unroll the strips and paste them using a roller to flatten them out. The Twirlywoos help the man by rolling the strips of the poster out of the van.

programme.title: Daniel Tigers Neighbourhood
programme.sub-title: Daniel And Katerina Listen To Each Other
programme.desc: Daniel is playing at Katerinas house and wants to put on a show, but Katerina isnt listening and keeps playing her own way.

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: Bing, Sula, Coco, Pando, Amma and Flop are making Leaf Pictures, but the wind whisks Cocos picture off the table! Bing catches it by stamping on her picture and now Cocos angry!

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Tiddles the Tortoise, Doctor Hamsters pet, has got stuck up a tree, again! Who can save him?

programme.title: The Adventures Of Paddington
programme.desc: Paddington is accidentally delivered inside a wardrobe to Mr Currys house. How will he get out before being discovered?

programme.title: Ben And Hollys Little Kingdom
programme.desc: It is harvest day. The Elves and fairies enlist the help of Mr Gnome in picking blackberries. If only they could stop him from eating them all...

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Miss Rabbit arrives with the broken Party Bus; this is a job for Grampy Rabbit! Once fixed, Mummy Rabbit and Rebecca Rabbit arrive with a cake as its Grampy Rabbits birthday.

programme.title: Ginger And The Vegesaurs
programme.desc: During a snowball fight, Ginger and the Pea-Rexes accidentally wake up a Kiwimammuthus from its hibernation and have to tire out the furry beast to get it back to sleep.

programme.title: Octonauts
programme.sub-title: The Octonauts And The Great Algae Escape
programme.desc: Captain Barnacles and crew must catch a runaway Octopod, when its hijacked by a group of crustaceans trying to escape their algae-infested waters.

programme.title: Tish Tash
programme.desc: Tish and Bobby go into Rosas art studio, even though they arent meant to go in there without her. Tish then, accidently, knocks ink all over Rosas latest picture.

programme.title: Play School: Let The Games Begin
programme.desc: Leah and Teo have fun outside playing backyard games! The toys, Maurice and Owl, compete in a sack race. Leah and Teo race in an obstacle course of their own makingall while balancing an egg (or orange) on a spoon!

programme.title: Mixmups
programme.desc: The Mixmups visit a sports stadium to fulfil Spins dream of becoming an Olympic gold medal winner. But uncharacteristically, Spin cant keep up with the others and keeps coming last.

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: Flop is pushing Bing on the swing in the park when Pando arrives and wants to have a go too.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: Mum wont let Bingo have Pavlova, so the kids find a way by playing a cheeky game of Cafe in the kitchen. But Dad the chef sets up a competing shop that only serves edamame beans.

programme.title: Mister Maker Around The World
programme.desc: In the UK, we find out whether he can make a funny fur hand in under a minute; in South Africa the Mini Makers help build a really wild animal picture; and in Hong Kong look out for some really arty fun with kitchen foil.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends: All Engines Go
programme.desc: When Terence breaks his tire tread, Thomas takes him to get fixed... and explore some of the island. Terences off-track energy isnt quite fit for more orderly places.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Daddy Pig has a new synthesiser. Peppa, George and Mummy Pig have fun finding and sampling sounds from around the house.

programme.title: Ginger And The Vegesaurs
programme.desc: Minty tries to fly and is mistaken for a Baby Bokchoydacty by its mother who takes Minty back to their nest. Ginger needs a rescue plan and fast!

programme.title: Builder Brothers Dream Factory
programme.desc: When noisy swans threaten to disrupt Carlos and Drews band performance, the Dream Factory Crew have to find a clever way to lead them away.

programme.title: Octonauts
programme.desc: After Shellington crashes the Gup-D, he and Kwazii team up with a moray eel and grouper fish to pick up the pieces.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends: Big World! Big Adventures!
programme.desc: Gordon becomes very worried when he gets a serious case of the giggles.

programme.title: Play School: When I Grow Up
programme.desc: Kaeng and Miah imagine being a National Park Ranger and a Garbage Truck Driver! Dan invents something to clean up rubbish at the beach, and Adam Goodes joins us to read his book Walk With Us: Welcome to Our Country!

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Cousin Chloe, Peppa and George pick flowers making daisy-chains and transforming George into a fearsome dandy-lion.

programme.title: Big Lizard
programme.desc: Big Lizard is jealous of the vacuum cleaner and hides it from Dad and Cosima. Ammon decides its her new best friend, whilst Cosima reassures Big Lizard he will always be her BFF.

programme.title: Kangaroo Beach
programme.desc: The cadets attempt to train four young kids as Junior Junior Cadets - but their first lesson is a disaster!

programme.title: PJ Masks
programme.desc: The PJMs defeat the Ninjas with ease, and become over-confident in their powers. But Night Ninjas secretly plotting to acquire PJ powers for himself.

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: Duggee and the Squirrels decide to play football. The Squirrels dont know what to do as theyve never played football before. Worm, Hennie and Ethel do their best to show them the rules.

programme.title: Supertato
programme.desc: Evil Pea pretends shes hurt her foot, so she can break the Tatoscope at Tato Tower.

programme.title: Star Wars: Young Jedi Adventures
programme.desc: The young Jedi set out to catch a thief.

programme.title: Ben And Hollys Little Kingdom
programme.desc: Holly takes some frogspawn home from class to look after, but is surprised when the frogspawn has turned into tadpoles by morning. Soon there are lots of little frogs for Holly to look after!

programme.title: Twirlywoos
programme.desc: A mans phone keeps ringing in a restaurant so he puts it in his briefcase. The Twirlywoos pass him the phone every time it rings. Going in and out of the briefcase until BigHoo throws the phone out and it lands in a glass.

programme.title: Daniel Tigers Neighbourhood
programme.desc: Daniel cant wait to use his new toy float in the Neighborhood pool. When the lifeguard, Prince Tuesday, tells him floaties arent allowed in the pool, Daniel is disappointed.

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: Pando and Sula sit in the Fire Engine but when its Bings turn; it leaves! Flop, Amma, Sula and Bing walk to Bings house where Arlo is stuck on the neighbours roof! Bing must help him get down.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: It is Granny and Grandpas anniversary. Peppa and George go to Mr Foxs Shop to find them a present. Mr Foxs Shop sells everything.

programme.title: The Adventures Of Paddington
programme.desc: Jonathan and Paddington dig up some broken pottery. It turns out its not Roman, but a statue made by Mrs Brown. But who broke it? Was it Judys guilty secret? Or was it Mr Brown?

programme.title: Isadora Moon
programme.desc: Isadora wants a non-magical, human birthday party but between Mums magical balloons and Wilbur appointing himself the party magician, Isadora and her friends end up floating into the sky beneath big magical balloons.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: Bluey and Bingo want a pet. To show them how much work theyd be in for, Dad transforms his hand into their old friend Shaun, a chaotic, undisciplined Emu with a taste for trouble.

programme.title: Knee High Spies
programme.desc: When Pranksy traps Deena in her original box, shes in danger of being regifted at a 6-year-olds birthday party. Jeremy and Squash must crash the party and bring her home.

programme.title: Fizzy And Suds
programme.desc: Fizzy and Suds explore cranes at docks and construction sites! They watch strong cranes lift heavy containers and tower cranes build tall buildings, and the crane operators gets a "bubble-eye" view of it all!

programme.title: Mecha Builders
programme.sub-title: Where Theres A Wheel Theres A Way
programme.desc: Sifs coming in for a landing at the rocket launch site, but when her rocket gets pushed off course she needs the Mecha Builders!

programme.title: Adventures Of Paddington: Birthday Treat
programme.desc: The Browns take Paddington to London as a special treat for his birthday but they lose him on the way! Paddington ends up in the Tower of London and has a close encounter with the Crown Jewels!

programme.title: Stan Can
programme.desc: Everyone wants Stanleys help. Myrtle to make pancakes, Jose to unpack boxes, Peggy to tidy her tree house and Ari to do groovy moves for the dance class. Stanley invents three Can Bots to help.

programme.title: Andy And The Band
programme.desc: Macs Aunty Rhona needs help getting rid of some troublesome ghosts from her guest house.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Cousin Chloe, Peppa and George pick flowers making daisy-chains and transforming George into a fearsome dandy-lion.

programme.title: Big Lizard
programme.desc: Dads favourite record wont play anymore so Cosima and Big Lizard secretly plan to learn the song and surprise him. But they have trouble recruiting a drummer.

programme.title: Builder Brothers Dream Factory
programme.desc: The Dream Factory - and their Twin-Bots - save the Robotics competition when Biff and Tiffs robots go wild.

programme.title: Octonauts
programme.desc: Returning home from a mission along an African river, the Octonauts have trouble getting past a gang of large, territorial hippos.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends: Big World! Big Adventures!
programme.desc: Thomas meets another big blue engine in Brazil that reminds him of Gordon.

programme.title: Play School Show Time
programme.desc: This episode is such a spectacle you could hang it in a gallery! Join Rove McManus as he shows off his sketching skills and entertains us with a fun drawing game that brings a variety of silly situations to life!

programme.title: Little J And Big Cuz
programme.desc: Little J is obsessed with the playground craze of "Knucks" while Big Cuz frets Sissy is choosing to play with a new phone instead of her.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Today Peppa is making a quilt for the new addition to the family. Together with Mummy Pig and Granny Pig, they collect old fabric and create a beautiful quilt embellished with memories.

programme.title: Peter Rabbit
programme.sub-title: The Tale Of The Scare Owl
programme.desc: When Peter uses a model owl to scare off Old Brown, he ends up scaring the squirrels too!

programme.title: Octonauts: Above And Beyond
programme.desc: In the aftermath of a fire in the Everglades, Ranger Marsh calls on Dashi and Tweak to help him figure out who stole a Florida box turtles egg.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: When Dad brings a pair of tenacious tickle crabs home from the beach, no where in the house is safe! His only hope of escaping their tickles is with help from his true love.

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: Duggee and the squirrels had a great adventure outside and want to tell everyone about it. What better way to tell a story than through a Puppet Show! First they make the puppets. Scissors! Card! Glue! Glitter! Feathers!

programme.title: Piripenguins
programme.desc: When Millie hosts a series of tough Penguin Games, Pancake and Nugget must stick together.

programme.title: Long Lost Family
programme.desc: Two stories that take us across the globe: a womans search for her birth mother in Sri Lanka and a quest on behalf of a father, longing to find his lost son.

programme.desc: Sophie Thomson meets a city gardener leading the good life, Jane Edmanson visits a floral haven in the hills, Jerry Coleby-Williams is on St Helena island and Costa Georgiadis explores a garden created for kids to go wild.

programme.desc: Rachel Griffiths sits down with some Aussie rock legends, and heads to the jungles of Vietnam in a bid to understand the music that united a divided nation.

programme.desc: When the body of a missing trawler man is pulled from the sea, DCI Vera Stanhope must delve into the lives of his family in a close knit fishing community.

programme.title: ABC Late News
programme.desc: Know the latest on the days top stories, as Michael Tetlow brings you a comprehensive roundup of the news of the day. ABC News has reporters across Australia and around the globe reporting on the issues that matter to you.

programme.title: ABC Late News
programme.desc: Follow the latest on todays news, covering whats happening and why it matters. ABC News has reporters across Australia and around the globe to bring you the news you need to know. Presented by Michael Tetlow in Perth.

programme.title: Landline
programme.desc: The barge ferrying cattle over the flooded Cooper Creek on the Birdsville Track; plus a luxurious new paddle steamer makes an 800km journey up the Murray River. (Final for 2025)

Sarah Ferguson presents Australias premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus reporting from Michael Rowland, Jacob Greber and the team.

programme.title: The Business
programme.desc: Australias leading daily business and finance show, bringing you up to date on market moves, economic trends and the forces affecting consumers, investors, employees and businesses big and small. Presented by Alicia Barry.

Sarah Ferguson presents Australias premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus reporting from Michael Rowland, Jacob Greber and the team.

programme.title: Landline
programme.desc: The barge ferrying cattle over the flooded Cooper Creek on the Birdsville Track; plus a luxurious new paddle steamer makes an 800km journey up the Murray River. (Final for 2025)

programme.title: ABC News Mornings
programme.desc: Stay in the know with whats happening this morning. ABC News brings you up-to-the-minute news to fuel your daily conversations so you can stay connected and follow the discussion across today. Presented by Kathryn Robinson.

programme.title: ABC News Day
programme.desc: As every story unfolds, catch each breaking moment and stay up to date. Lorna Dunkley brings you the latest news, interviews, analysis and original reporting on the issues that matter to you.

programme.title: Afternoon Briefing
programme.desc: Your daily download of everything you need to know about politics, national and global affairs. Patricia Karvelas asks politicians the tough questions and talks to key players and experts on the issues driving the news cycle.

programme.title: ABC News Hour
programme.desc: Stay in the know with Australias trusted news source. From your neighbourhood, across the country and around the world, ABC News bring you the days top stories and latest news, all verified. Presented by Joe OBrien.

programme.title: Disconnected: The Teen Social Media Ban
programme.desc: As Australia prepares to restrict access for under 16s to social media platforms, we talk to teens and experts about a move being closely watched by the big tech giants, platforms and countries grappling with the use of data.

programme.title: Close Of Business
programme.desc: Inflation remains stubbornly above the RBAs target range. Ahead of the Reserve Banks final decision on interest rates for 2025, there is now a realistic chance of an interest rate hike sometime in the next six months.

programme.title: Asia News Week
programme.desc: Yvonne Yong brings you a weekly roundup of the stories making news across the Asia region, plus whats trending on social media and making an impact on the culture and the way people live.

programme.title: The Breakfast Couch
programme.desc: Bridget Brennan, James Glenday, Catherine Murphy, Charles Brice and Nate Byrne hear from some of the guests who appeared on News Breakfast. Plus film critic Zak Hepburn and resident foodie Alice Zaslavsky.

programme.title: Witness To History - David Brill
programme.desc: A look at the life and work of legendary ABC cinematographer David Brill.

programme.title: DW News
programme.desc: The latest international news and the days top stories from a European perspective. Our broadcast partner DW brings you live coverage from Berlin with updated reports and expert analysis on the big global issues and events.

programme.title: DW News
programme.desc: The latest international news and the days top stories from a European perspective. Our broadcast partner DW brings you live coverage from Berlin with updated reports and expert analysis on the big global issues and events.

programme.title: The World This Week
programme.desc: Girish Sawlani brings you a weekly roundup of international news from an Australian perspective as reported by ABC News correspondents covering the Indo Pacific, Europe, North America, the Middle East, India and Indonesia.

programme.title: Jim Maxwells Ashes Memories
programme.sub-title: 1972 - A Bob Massie Masterclass at Lords
programme.desc: Jim Maxwell and Corbin Middlemas look back at some of the moments that have defined the Ashes rivalry. Part two follows Jim to Lords in 1972 where he watched from the stands as Bob Massie put on a bowling clinic.

programme.title: ABC News Update
programme.desc: Start your morning with the latest headlines from ABC News, updating you on the days top stories and the overnight news from across Australia and around the world.

programme.title: Disconnected: The Teen Social Media Ban
programme.desc: As Australia prepares to restrict access for under 16s to social media platforms, we talk to teens and experts about a move being closely watched by the big tech giants, platforms and countries grappling with the use of data.

programme.desc: Lorna Dunkley presents the latest from ABC News on the weekend bringing you todays top stories and coverage of events as they unfold. Plus original reporting, analysis and updated news, sport, weather and information.

programme.title: ABC National News
programme.desc: Theres never been a more important time for transparency and trust. ABC News brings you the days top stories and latest news with more reporters to tell you whats going on and why it matters. Presented by Fiona Willan.
